{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.15653v1", "title": "On a geometric comparison of representations of real and $p$-adic
  $\mathbf{GL}_n$", "summary": "In this paper, we use geometric methods to study the relations between
admissible representations of $\mathbf{GL}_n(\mathbb{C})$ and unramified
representations of $\mathbf{GL}_m(\mathbb{Q}_p)$. We show that the geometric
relationship between Langlands parameter spaces of $\mathbf{GL}_n(\mathbb{C})$
and $\mathbf{GL}_m(\mathbb{Q}_p)$ constructed by the first named author is
compatible with the functor recently defined algebraically by Chan-Wong. We
then show that the said relationship intertwines translation functors on
representations of $\mathbf{GL}_n(\mathbb{C})$ and partial
Bernstein-Zelevinskii derivatives on representations of
$\mathbf{GL}_m(\mathbb{Q}_p)$, providing purely geometric counterparts to some
results of Chan-Wong. In the sequels, the techniques of this work will be
extended to other classical groups and used to study their Arthur packets.", "main_category": "math.RT", "categories": "math.RT", "published": "2025-04-22T07:21:00Z"}
